full_threads.body:
Hi Trish, 


Please check out the new and improved form. We have doe the Studio Audience form for you first to check, and then we can apply to the other one if you give us the go ahead: https://msra.org.au/progress-ms-research-live-update-2018/studio-audience-registration-2018/ 


Please use your real email address too so that you receive the confirmation email and let me know any copy changes you would like it there.  


Thanks and speak soon,

Brilliant – thanks so much


Cheers


Trish



Petricia Augustus


Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467


paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Hi Trish, 


We will have this to you this afternoon. We are tweaking a few things to take advantage of the imminent Stripe integration. We are removing some coding that will be superseded by the upcoming changes. The reason for the removal of some code is to keep the site nice and lite and future proof. 


I'll be in touch. Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Heath


Wondering how you are tracking with the registration pages?


I’m working towards sending out the invite tomorrow if possible. I can stall until Monday if needed.


Thanks


Trish



Petricia Augustus


Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467


paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Thank you.



Petricia Augustus


Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467


paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Hi Trish, 


Sure, we will get this to you today. We will be able to achieve the multiple user registrations. I thought it was only for the contact details. Leave it with me.


Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Heath


Only just getting to the testing now – apologies for the delay


On this form


https://msra.org.au/progress-ms-research-live-update-2018/studio-audience-registration-2018/


· Please can you remove the compulsory fields from the position and company fields and if attended before and relationship to MS.


· Can the condition of entry text be the same size as the text above – it seems to be much larger.


· The submit button is very small, almost too hard to see


· If registering other attendees – wondering why it would not come up like we did for last year’s event, this structure seems different. I will need to collect the same information from each person – ie does the extra person require wheelchair access, what is their position/ title, what is their relationship to MS. I feel as though our previous template was set up for person 1 and then person two. It asked at the top how many people they were registering for.


Please can you check the format from last year – I don’t think we have nailed it. First question should be how many people, then collecting the details. Sorry if I didn’t make that clear.


On this form


https://msra.org.au/progress-ms-research-live-update-2018/live-stream-registration-2018/


· The submit button is very small, almost too hard to see


· Please can you remove the compulsory fields from the have you attended before, phone number and relationship to MS.


On both forms – can we also add a field where people can subscribe to the MS Research Australia newsletter – an opt in / opt out button. The reason why is that I will be asking the various MS societies to promote this event so we might capture new people for the event and would be good to also get them to subscribe.


Please let me know if any of the above doesn’t make sense.


Thanks


Trish



Petricia Augustus


Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467


paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Thanks Heath, I’ll test it today



Petricia Augustus


Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467


paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Hi Trish, 


We have created the forms and they are ready for you to test. The buttons on this page https://msra.org.au/progress-ms-research-live-update-2018/ are linked up to their respective forms. 


Let me know how that goes? 


Thanks,

Hi Heath


Thank you for adding the blue arrow button, it does help.


I have updated the document re the two forms – see attached. However please note that for the studio audience I need to know how many people will be attending and details for each person. I don’t think the screen shot in the doc was what we actually used last time though and I can’t remember how to find it in the site - apologies.


Also I would like to add in a disclaimer re the filming. Not sure if that is best to put in as a check box or just a note at the bottom of the form. Appreciate your advice on that.


For the format and cost buttons at the top – can they click through to the blue arrow that you added – that way it is just under the registration and just above the agenda.


I have Monday off on annual leave but back Tuesday. Would be great if it could be ready for me to test on Tuesday and then if it’s all of then we could go live on Wednesday or some time this week.


Thanks


Trish



Petricia Augustus


Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467


paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Thanks Heath I will action this in the morning. Thank you


Kind regards


Trish

Hi Trish, 


I forgot to mention regarding the forms. We are waiting on confirmation of the fields, please see attached and let me know if these are the final ones we should be creating?  


Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Trish, 


We have added a 'down' arrow under the two orange buttons and linked both the 'When' and 'Where' icons to their respective locations on the page. There is no logical location to link the 'Cost' and 'Format' icons to though. 


Let me know your thoughts? Thanks,

Hi Heath

I have completed the information on the new live update page https://msra.org.au/progress-ms-research-live-update-2018/

I have received comment that when people are looking at the page they might think that the page ends at the registration buttons and that there is nothing below it – is there some way that we can make it obvious that there is more information below.

Also can the 4 round buttons at the top be clickable and click down to the relevant sections below.

Lastly, How can I get the registration form activated with the relevant information?

Thanks

Trish

Petricia Augustus

Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations

MS Research Australia

02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467

paugustus@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au

Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060
